basics.name: Nick Reilly
basics.label: Ph.D. in Physics
basics.summary: Fresh PhD with extensive experience in physics and astronomy, specialized in infrared detectors for space astrophysics. Skilled in laboratory research, equipment maintenance, and data analysis.

work.position: Graduate Research Assistant-Infrared Detectors for Space Astrophysics
work.summary: Research on infrared detectors for space astrophysics, including development of analysis pipelines, equipment installation, and maintenance.
highlights: Developed analysis pipeline for NEO Surveyor calibration.
Installed and maintained advanced detector systems in cryogenic conditions.

work.summary: Focused on biophysical research related to cell motility and viral infection impacts on cell dynamics.
highlights: Developed specific assays for CD4+ T Cells.

work.summary: Used ultra short laser pulses to study the breakup of nitrogen molecules.
highlights: Collaborated in the design process for a new clean room facility in China.
Supported other students and postdocs on surface experiments, including hydrophobic and hydrophilic metals and plastics without coatings.

work.summary: Lead workshops, graded, and maintained office hours for undergraduate mechanics for non‑physics majors.
Primary support for safety and heavy metal analysis, operating various testing equipment and enhancing SOPs.
highlights: Enhanced testing procedures and automated basic tests.

work.summary: Created the (then) current smallest Lead-Sulfide quantum dots using cheap wet lab chemistry methods.
highlights: Assisted construction of the Sun lab, calibrating optical equipment, electromagnets, and a chemical synthesis bench for nanostructure production.
Participated in the production of Lead Sulfide nanosheet synthesis, and their characterization.
Developed a procedure for a dip coating machine that efficiently made thin films of quantum dots and nanosheets.

work.summary: Responsible for building and running audio equipment for live events.
highlights: Assembled PA systems for all sized events, including events through Bowling Green State University, town festivals, sporting events, and philanthropic events
Ran the board for many different types of production events.
Experienced as an artist for a large campus event.
